column4: Does anyone have any ideas of a way to get several package files onto a computer that can't get internet? (Specifically ubuntu-restricted-extras, compizconfig-settings-manager, emerald, screenlets, vlc)
you can download the debs then get them on a media that you can get into the computer without internet
the only "problem" is you need to make sure you include all the dependencies...

I figured that much, my problem is trying to GET the package files to be able to transfer them... Someone suggested Apt-on-CD but it only got things from the update manager... none of my personal downloaded packaged
the site http://packages.ubuntu.com/ lists the dependencies for each package
But where can I go to actually get the package files to transfer them?
for instance take this one:
http://cz.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/a/adduser/adduser_3.110ubuntu5_all.deb
use "wget" on the Linux commandline to get the deb
or use a web browser to download it.
But how can I find out the web address for the specific package file? all I know is it's name, eg. ubuntu-restricted-extras
just browse http://packages.ubuntu.com
if you search there for ubuntu-restricted-extras
you'll get http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=ubuntu-restricted-extras&searchon=names&suite=jaunty&section=all
then click on "jaunty" (for instance)
I see. I thought you were somehow trying to do like sudo wget ubuntu-restricted-extras and I wasn't following lol
then right click one of the mirrors and choose Copy Link Location
then paste that after "wget"
this needs to be like this since you might be downloading for a completely different version of Ubuntu
I just hadn't noticed that you could download the debs off packages.ubuntu.com
there you go :-)
